paper_abstract: The harmonic index H(G) of a graph G is defined as the sum of weights 2/d(u) + d(v) of all edges uv of G, where d(u) denotes the degree of a vertex u in G. In this paper, we first present a sharp lower bound on the harmonic index of unicyclic conjugated graphs (unicyclic graphs with a perfect matching). Also a sharp lower bound on the harmonic index of unicyclic graphs is given in terms of the order and given size of matching.
paper_title: On the Harmonic Index of Unicyclic Conjugated Molecules
